Interface Game<P extends Player<A>, A extends Action>

Type Parameters:
P - type of players
A - type of actions
All Known Implementing Classes:
MarioGame
public interface Game<P extends Player<A>, A extends Action>
Describes games for the specified type of player and action.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Class<? extends Action>
    getActionClass()
    Returns the class of the actions used in the game (for readable logging).
    P
    getNextPlayer()
    Returns the next player of the turn.
    List<Pair<Constructor<? extends P>, Object[]>>

    Returns the constructor and its parameters of the players for the Engine.
    P[]
    getPlayers()
    Returns the players of the game.
    long
    getRemainingTime(P player)
    Returns the remaining game-time of the specified player in nanoseconds.
    double
    getScore(P player)
    Returns the score of the specified player.
    long
    getTimeout()
    Returns the overall running time for a player of the game in nanoseconds.

    Checks the end of the game.

    Checks the correctness of the specified action.

    Sets the specified action of the specified player for the game and the elapsed time, was taken to compute the action.

    The Engine sets the constructed players and the corresponding construction times.

      Checks the correctness of the specified action.

      Returns:

    • setAction

      void setAction(P player, A action, long time)
      Sets the specified action of the specified player for the game and the elapsed time, was taken to compute the action.
      Parameters:

      action - to be set
      time - computation time in nanoseconds
